phrases: They are all working very hard.
This is the inside of a human body.
RED BLOOD CELLS: Red because they contain large amounts of hemoglobin.
They carry oxygen and carbon dioxide using blood circulation.
I have come to deliver your oxygen!
Thanks for all your hard work.
Appreciate your coming through such a cramped pathway.
We will collect your carbon dioxide here.
Hey, I see you are hard at work on your own!
Looks like you have done some growing up!
You have a smug look on your face,
but that is what is expected of you, okay?
But I still worry about you.
Are you sure you will be okay on your own?
Stay away from danger and just make a run for it, all right?
I have never heard of a blood cell who only seems to run into trouble.
Our friends are being chased by a germ!
W-We have got to help them!
There is nothing we can do!
I mean, we are Red Blood Cells.
Did I just manage to dodge that?
Maybe I have a chance of getting away!
If only you would handed over that oxygen like a good girl,
you would not have gotten yourself killed!
You can she would your tears in the next world!
WHITE BLOOD CELLS (NEUTROPHILS): Their main task is to eliminate foreign substances from outside, such as bacteria and viruses.
Neutrophils comprise over half of the White Blood Cells in the blood.
The person in the mask over there took him out for me.
What is the name of that cell?
Another Immune Cell assigned to this blood vessel.
MONOCYTES: Mononuclear, migratory cells which comprise seven percent of all White Blood Cells.
Like other Immune Cells, they take part in biological defense.
Mononuclear, migratory cells which comprise seven percent of all White Blood Cells.
Like other Immune Cells, they take part in biological defense.
PHAGOCYTOSIS: When Phagocytes such as Monocytes, Macrophages or White Blood Cells (Neutrophils) consume and break down foreign substances or bacteria.
There are not that many in the blood vessel,
but Monocyte's awesome at phagocytosis and migration,
so you are always in good hands with him!
H-He is practicing his golf swing.
So there are all kinds of migratory routes, huh?
MIGRATION: To move freely through the system.
Keep up the good work, all right?
Thank you for your hard work.
Please stop by for a short break...
THE NASAL CAVITY: An organ located at the entrance to the respiratory system.
To prevent damage to the delicate pulmonary alveoli walls, it warms and humidifies the air that enters the body.
If you are heading to the pulmonary alveoli, please feel free to stop by!
BATH FOR YOUR FEET THE NASAL CAVITY
That looks like it feels so good!
What is that you are eating?
RED BLOOD CELLS ARE FOND OF SUGAR: Unlike White Blood Cells and other common cells, Red Blood Cells have no mitochondria, so glucose is their only energy source.
I am going to go back for another steamed bun for sure!
Good afternoon, all you lovely cells!
STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS: An antigen residing in the skin and pores.
It is highly toxic, and if it invades the body through an abrasion, it can cause skin infections, food poisoning, pneumonia, meningitis, sepsis and the like.
An antigen residing in the skin and pores.
It is highly toxic, and if it invades the body through an abrasion,
it can cause skin infections, food poisoning, pneumonia, meningitis, sepsis and the like.
but I am going to conquer this nasal cavity now.
This time for sure, target sighted!
The White Blood Cells are here!
You guys, do not forget your coagulation factor!
They are the only ones left standing!
We can take them out right now!
Another new strain of Staphylococcus Aureus, huh?
It will always be the same every time you come!
Not bad, would not you say?
Turns out you were the one with the flaky friends.
We are going to bring you down no matter what!
And you and your friends are all going to get wiped out!
Well, are you sure about that?
Th-They are like a bunch of grapes!
HOW THE STAPHYLOCOCCUS GOT ITS NAME: Multiple Staphylococci form a grape-like cluster, hence the name Staphylococcus, meaning grape-like.
How the Staphylococcus got its name.
Multiple Staphylococci form a grape-like cluster,
hence the name Staphylococcus, meaning grape-like.
See, what did I tell you?
Then, why do not I devour you?
FIBRIN: A protein involved in clotting the blood.
Has a mesh-like or rice cake-like quality.
A protein involved in clotting the blood.
Has a mesh-like or rice cake-like quality.
Attach the fibrin to the coagulation factors like this.
Is that the thing you Platelets created to close up the wound?
What is she doing with that fibrin?
I have heard about this before!
It is one of the tactics of Staphylococcus Aureus!
By wrapping herself up in fibrin, she can block our attacks!
The name of that move is...
Hey, do not steal my thunder!
Right now, both my defensive and offensive powers are off the charts!
COAGULASE: An enzyme that brings about the coagulation of blood by precipitating fibrin.
The bacteria that produce this use fibrin as a barrier to evade White Blood Cell attacks.
An enzyme that brings about the coagulation of blood by precipitating fibrin.
use fibrin as a barrier to evade White Blood Cell attacks.
Meaning that none of your lowly attacks can touch me.
And thanks to my attack power,
What happened to White Blood Cell and the others?
Looks like both your hands and feet are tied.
Your feet are intact at least!
Or you are going to end up dead!
You are going to fall outside the blood vessel!
At last, I can get my revenge on you, you nasty Neutrophil!
This one's for our younger cousin
who invaded this body before and got herself killed.
Now then, if I can just
Oh my, that is the outside of the blood vessel right there!
we are going to change costumes now!
MACROPHAGES AND MONOCYTES: Monocytes are produced in the bone marrow, and reside in the bloodstream, but when they circulate outside the blood vessel, they become Macrophages.
Monocytes are produced in the bone marrow, and reside in the bloodstream,
but when they circulate outside the blood vessel, they become Macrophages.
I do not know what kind of cells you are,
but do not you dare get in my way!
Who knew you were actually strong?
Wait, do not tell me they are...
MACROPHAGE: A type of White Blood Cell.
Captures and kills foreign substances such as bacteria, and finds antigens and immunity information.
Also acts as a cleaner, tidying up dead cells and bacteria.
A type of White Blood Cell.
Captures and kills foreign substances such as bacteria,
and finds antigens and immunity information.
Also acts as a cleaner, tidying up dead cells and bacteria.
No thanks, I am outta here!
We do not stand a chance against them!
This is no time to bail!
What are we going to do with you?
You are on the same side.
Do not you dare mock me!
We are going to bulldoze right through them!
Allow me to apply the finishing touch, will you?
Looks like we just got burned to a crisp today.
Really, we sure owe you one, Macrophage.
Who knows how it would have ended up if it was just us?
Oh my, but it is all because you held them off.
We just arrived late to the party!
I am thrilled to have been of use!
That is our signal when we are Monocytes!
Right, it is the signal we use when we are Monocytes.
You are one and the same?
Wait, but how did you get inside that...
No, wait, all that muscular strength...
All maidens have a secret or two, you know!
It sure is hot, huh, Platelet?
What is happening is called global warming, they say.
But it is still too hot this year, right?

Please have some cold barley tea!
